com.ibm.mqtt
Interface MqttSimpleCallback

All Known Subinterfaces:
MqttAdvancedCallback
public interface MqttSimpleCallback

This interface class defines the methods that will be called if the simple callback mechanism is implemented. Using the simple callback interface a class can be notified of publications arriving and the TCP/IP connection unexpectedly terminating.

Method Summary
 void connectionLost()
          Called by the MQTT session if the TCP/IP connection unexpectedly terminates
This method should attempt to reconnect using the connect method.
 void publishArrived(java.lang.String thisTopicName, byte[] thisPayload, int QoS, boolean retained)
          Called by the MQTT session when it receives a publish message from the broker.
 

Method Detail

connectionLost

void connectionLost()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Called by the MQTT session if the TCP/IP connection unexpectedly terminates
This method should attempt to reconnect using the connect method. If the cleanstart flag was specified then this method should also resubscribe for all topics that the client is interested in receiving. If the connection lost method is unable to reconnect then it should throw an exception. This exception will then be thrown by the API whenever a publish or subscribe method is called to indicate that there is a problem.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if connectionLost is unable to re-establish the connection.

publishArrived

void publishArrived(java.lang.String thisTopicName,
                    byte[] thisPayload,
                    int QoS,
                    boolean retained)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Called by the MQTT session when it receives a publish message from the broker.

NOTE:
Any implementation of this method should NOT call any of the other API methods as this will cause a deadlock. Blocking for a significant amount of time is also not advised. If API calls or blocking are required in this method, then the method should start up a new thread to do the work.

Parameters:
thisTopicName - The topic from which data was received
thisPayload - A byte array containing the data received
QoS - The Quality of Service at which the pulication was delivered by the broker
retained - Is this a retained publication?
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the application is unable to receive the publication.
